incidents.name: Connectivity Delays on Super SIM

incident_updates.body: We observed recovery starting around 08:00 Pacific Time, and IMSI switching by impacted SIMs have stopped. Customers that had their SIM cards change IMSI may remain on the alternative IMSI for up to 24 hours before it switches back. At this time, engineers are monitoring recovery. Any further updates will be posted to the KORE status page. https://korewireless.service-now.com/csm?id=service_status&service=cb4ae2ca479f0610ab11f92c016d43f1#current_status_degradation

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 5:00 Pacific Time, we began experiencing delays in devices connecting to the network due to issues with the primary IMSIs on Super SIM. Devices may experience a connection delay (between 3 and 9 minutes) as they transition to back up IMSIs to restore full connectivity.  Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner if more information becomes available. For further updates, please visit Super SIM’s new home on KORE’s status page: https://korewireless.service-now.com/csm?id=service_status&service=cb4ae2ca479f0610ab11f92c016d43f1#current_status_degradation

incidents.name: 500 Errors in Programmable Messaging API

incident_updates.body: Twilio Programmable Messaging API and Verify were degraded for 5 minutes between 06:03 and 06:08 Pacific Time on 12/02/2024. During this period of time, customers sending messages may have received 5xx's in API responses. The issue has now been resolved.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue Programmable Messaging API. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
